metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3326 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 andearlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program,potentially resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2').
